page.title: Technical Analysis
page.subtitle: Test your trading knowledge and sharpen your skills with our interactive technical analysis quiz — assess your grasp of chart patterns, indicators, and market psychology to become a more confident, professional trader.

quiz.selectHint: Choose an option, then submit your answer.

tier.excellent: Excellent! Your technical analysis knowledge is very strong.
tier.good: Good job! Keep practicing to improve further.
tier.retry: A solid start — review the lessons and try again.

pool.q: What does the Simple Moving Average (SMA) primarily help traders with?
options: The average price over a set period to reduce noise
pool.correct: The average price over a set period to reduce noise
pool.explain: The SMA smooths price data by averaging it over a chosen period, helping reveal the overall trend.

pool.q: Which moving average reacts faster to recent price changes?
pool.correct: EMA
pool.explain: The EMA gives more weight to recent prices, so it responds faster than the SMA and usually faster than the WMA.

pool.q: A typical buy signal from a moving-average crossover occurs when…
options: The short MA crosses above the long MA
The long MA crosses above the short MA
pool.correct: The short MA crosses above the long MA
pool.explain: A bullish crossover often signals positive momentum; the reverse can signal bearish momentum.

pool.q: A drawback of using moving averages is that they…
options: Predict the market in advance and pinpoint tops/bottoms
Lag price action and can generate false signals in ranging markets
Only work on the daily timeframe
pool.correct: Lag price action and can generate false signals in ranging markets
pool.explain: MAs are lagging indicators and can mislead in non-trending conditions.

pool.q: What is the main purpose of Bollinger Bands?
options: Showing volatility and relative highs/lows around a moving average
pool.correct: Showing volatility and relative highs/lows around a moving average
pool.explain: The bands expand and contract with volatility and show relative price levels around the average.

pool.q: When price touches or closes outside the upper Bollinger Band, it often indicates…
options: An expansion in momentum or volatility (not always overbought)
pool.correct: An expansion in momentum or volatility (not always overbought)
pool.explain: A move outside the bands can indicate strong momentum; confirm with broader context.

pool.q: A common Bollinger Bands setting is:
pool.correct: 20-period average with ±2 standard deviations
pool.explain: The classic setup is a 20-period MA with ±2σ bands; adjust for market and timeframe as needed.

pool.q: The Williams Alligator indicator consists of:
options: Three lines: jaw, teeth, and lips
pool.correct: Three lines: jaw, teeth, and lips
pool.explain: It uses three smoothed averages with different offsets: jaw (slow), teeth (medium), lips (fast).

pool.q: When the Alligator lines are intertwined (sleeping), this indicates:
options: A ranging phase or low volatility
pool.correct: A ranging phase or low volatility
pool.explain: Intertwined lines suggest consolidation; traders often wait for them to diverge before entering.

pool.q: The Alligator is considered ‘feeding’ (strong trend) when:
options: The three lines spread out and align with price direction
Only price moves while lines remain flat
pool.correct: The three lines spread out and align with price direction
pool.explain: Diverging lines in the direction of price indicate a developing trend.

pool.q: RSI readings above 70 typically indicate:
pool.correct: Overbought conditions (possible pullback)
pool.explain: Overbought can persist in strong trends; confirm with price structure.

pool.q: An RSI value near 30 typically indicates:
pool.correct: Oversold (possible bounce)
pool.explain: Like overbought, oversold can persist; combine with price action for better entries.

pool.q: A bullish RSI divergence occurs when:
options: Price makes higher highs while RSI makes lower highs
Price makes lower lows while RSI makes higher lows
pool.correct: Price makes lower lows while RSI makes higher lows
pool.explain: Losing momentum as price prints new lows can suggest a potential bullish reversal.

pool.q: What’s the best description of a support zone?
options: A price level where buying demand is likely to appear
A level where selling must occur
A fixed line that is never broken
pool.correct: A price level where buying demand is likely to appear
pool.explain: Support is an area where demand has historically shown up; it can sometimes be broken.

pool.q: What’s the best description of a resistance zone?
options: A price level where selling supply is likely to appear
A concept based only on volume
pool.correct: A price level where selling supply is likely to appear
pool.explain: Resistance is the opposite of support — where supply notably appears.

pool.q: Which combination increases signal reliability?
options: Using a single indicator on one timeframe
Adding many indicators of the same type
pool.correct: Combining diverse signals (trend + momentum + structure)
pool.explain: Confluence reduces false signals; use diverse tools and check multiple timeframes.

pool.q: In a ranging (non-trending) market, which tools are more effective?
pool.correct: Oscillators like RSI or Stochastics
pool.explain: Oscillators help spot reversals at range extremes; MAs may give whipsaw signals.

pool.q: Which statement about indicators is most accurate?
options: They guarantee profits if tuned correctly
They are decision-support tools, not profit guarantees
They only work on crypto charts
They eliminate the need for risk management
pool.correct: They are decision-support tools, not profit guarantees
pool.explain: No indicator guarantees profits; pair them with risk management and discipline.

pool.q: Why use multiple timeframes in analysis?
options: To align higher-timeframe trend with lower-timeframe entries
pool.correct: To align higher-timeframe trend with lower-timeframe entries
pool.explain: Top-down analysis offers clearer context and more precise timing.

pool.q: What’s a common mistake when back-testing indicators?
options: Over-fitting the indicator to past data
pool.correct: Over-fitting the indicator to past data
pool.explain: Over-tuning fails in live conditions; test on fresh data and include realistic costs.
